sense.name: Inhabit or be in an area, possibly a nest; engage in behaviors reminiscent of birds tending to their young.
sense.commentary: Note: This sense contains many metaphorical instances.
sense.examples: Birds nest outside my window every spring. Young couples often nest for a period before getting to know the neighbors. The countryside nested farms, cattle, barns, and berry thickets. The children nested through the night in their sleeping bags.

sense.name: Fit inside (one another) in a systematic way.
sense.examples: Subparts of the procedure nest together to support the overall design. Russian dolls nest inside one another. The bowls nest to take up less space in the cabinet.

sense.name: Gather nests.
sense.examples: The children are nesting in the forest today while the others hunt.
